content.description: A short technical face that's just off vertical.
content.location:
Located on the south face of a huge boulder right of

Trap Door

; tunnel through from the base of that route.

content.description: This is due east of the parking area, but you need to walk around the north end of Stirrup Towers to get there. It's an obvious left-facing dihedral on a north-facing wall. This route is outside the actual corridor.

climbs.name: Jump On It
climbs.fa: Lavon Weighall and Chuck Davis, October 1988

content.description: This is a short thin face with fun moves on excellent rock; it faces south.

Horseshoe begins at the same location as

Hand Grenade

(5.10a crack). Mantle onto a ledge (5.10a) and traverse left to the first of four bolts. Sustained moves on edges lead to the second bolt (powerful to clip). The third bolt is approx. 15 ft. up an left. The rock quality is suspect directly above the second bolt but improves. Technical moves up and right lead to the fourth bolt. Continue up and right to a nice hand crack (5.8) and follow it to the top.

The path the route follows is like a Horseshoe turned on its side. If the rock quality was better I would give the climb two or possibly three out of three stars.
content.protection: Four well-spaced bolts protect the majority of this steep and sustained face climb. An optional 2" cam will fit in the 5.8 hand crack near the top.  Three distantly spaced bolts on top can be used to set up an anchor.

climbs.name: Hand Grenade
climbs.fa: Don Reid and Alan Bartlett, December 1984

content.description: This is a steep, clean, fairly long hand crack in a shaded location.
content.location:
in a corridor near the north end of Stirrup Towers, on an east-facing wall. To get into the corridor, walk past

Trap Door

on your left, then pass the left side of a large boulder (see arrow here:

To get to the Hand Grenade route, from the northeast walk past Trap Door on your left, pass the boulder in this picture on the left side, then turn left and scramble into the corridor.

), then turn left and scramble into the corridor.

content.description: Climbs a mottled, dished slab with a low crux and no protection.
content.location:
Located 5 feet left of an obvious left-facing corner -

Trap Door

.
